entries.title: Stock Investing
entries.description: Long-term value investing strategies, fundamental analysis, and portfolio design.

entries.title: Analyzing Stock Trends
entries.description: Explore trendlines, indicators, market phases, and chart patterns.

entries.title: Stock Market
entries.description: Structure of exchanges, trading rules, indices, liquidity and participants.

entries.title: Investing
entries.description: Foundations of investing, portfolio management, styles, metrics, global markets.

entries.title: Investing Practices
entries.description: Best practices for asset selection, diversification, and rebalancing.

entries.title: Day Trading Strategies
entries.description: Learn candlesticks, scalping, momentum plays, and intraday risk control.

entries.title: Impact of Global Events on Stocks
entries.description: Geopolitical, economic, and crisis-based events affecting market sentiment.

entries.title: Business School Courses
entries.description: MBA, Financial Masters, EMBA curriculum including strategy, operations, finance.

entries.title: Develop and Sell Mobile Apps
entries.description: App monetization, marketing, ASO, product design for App Store success.

entries.title: Economics
entries.description: Macro and micro theories, models, inflation, unemployment, policy frameworks.

entries.title: Ray Dalio
entries.description: Life principles, economic models, videos, Bridgewater culture and strategy.

entries.title: Learning to Meditate
entries.description: Reduce stress, build focus, and develop mindfulness through step-by-step mindmaps.

entries.title: Trend Identification
entries.description: Trend Identification is the process of recognizing the prevailing market directionâ€”whether bullish, bearish, or neutral.

entries.title: Indicators & Tools
entries.description: Technical indicators and tools assist traders in quantifying price data to confirm trends and identify reversals.

entries.title: Patterns & Structures
entries.description: Chart patterns and structures reveal recurring formations that signal potential reversals or continuations.

entries.title: Risk & Strategy
entries.description: Effective risk management and clear trading strategies are key to long-term trading success.

entries.title: Trend Lines
entries.description: Trend lines connect successive swing highs or lows to indicate the direction and strength of a trend.

entries.title: Moving Averages
entries.description: Moving averages smooth price data to help identify trends by filtering out short-term fluctuations.

entries.title: Market Phases
entries.description: Market phases describe the cyclical behavior of asset prices and help traders anticipate trend changes.

entries.title: Support & Resistance
entries.description: Support and resistance levels indicate price zones where buying or selling pressure is concentrated.

entries.title: RSI
entries.description: The Relative Strength Index (RSI) is a momentum oscillator that helps identify overbought or oversold conditions.

entries.title: MACD
entries.description: MACD (Moving Average Convergence Divergence) shows the relationship between two moving averages to signal momentum changes.

entries.title: Bollinger Bands
entries.description: Bollinger Bands consist of a moving average and two standard deviation lines to illustrate market volatility.

entries.title: Volume Analysis
entries.description: Volume analysis interprets the traded volume to confirm trends or signal potential reversals.

entries.title: Chart Patterns
entries.description: Chart patterns are identifiable shapes in price data that can indicate future market behavior.

entries.title: Candlestick Patterns
entries.description: Candlestick patterns, based on Japanese charting techniques, provide visual insights into market sentiment.

entries.title: Breakouts & Pullbacks
entries.description: Breakouts signal fresh momentum while pullbacks offer potential re-entry opportunities in a trend.

entries.title: Price Channels
entries.description: Price channels, formed by parallel trendlines, help define overbought or oversold market conditions.

entries.title: Stop-Loss Placement
entries.description: Stop-loss placement is essential for risk management, limiting potential losses when the market moves against you.

entries.title: Position Sizing
entries.description: Position sizing determines how much capital to risk on a trade based on your risk tolerance.

entries.title: Trend Following Strategy
entries.description: Trend following strategies aim to capture large price movements by riding sustained market trends.

entries.title: Counter-Trend Strategy
entries.description: Counter-trend strategies seek to profit from short-term reversals against the prevailing trend.
